title: morrigan_aensland
body:
[b]Morrigan Aensland[/b] ([b]モリガン・アーンスランド[/b]) is the de facto main character from the [[Darkstalkers]] series of fighting games.

Morrigan is a [[demon girl|succubus]] who is very vain and lives for little more than the excitement of battle. She appears as a beautiful woman with [[long hair|long]], light [[green hair]], [[large breasts]] and [[bat wings|bat-like wings]] on her back and on the [[head wings|sides of her head]], artwork tends to depict her with either [[green eyes|green]] or [[yellow eyes|yellow]] eyes. Morrigan can reshape these wings into spikes and blades when attacking her enemies, as well as using them to shield herself from enemy attacks. Her [[wings]] can also separate from her, and form into a cloud of bats. She uses a variety of magical attacks as well. Her standard outfit reveals a large amount of [[cleavage]] and [[heart cutout]] on her [[leotard]].

Originally planned to be a vampire in her debut, Morrigan's appearance made way for the popular depiction of succubi in Japanese media.
other_names: モリガン・アーンスランド

title: ultraman_ribut
body:
A character from the [[Ultra Series]]. He was created by the joint collaboration between Les' Copaque Productions, the creators of [[Upin & Ipin]], and [[Tsuburaya Productions]]. Ribut first appeared in "episodes 25 to 27":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r2lij3HObuM] in the 8th season and "episodes 28 to 30":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9QCnvYJKHaM] in the 9th season of Upin & Ipin, and made his first canon on-screen appearance in the Ultra Series in [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: New Generation Heroes]]. 

Since then, he reappeared in the followup to New Generation Heroes, [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Absolute Conspiracy]] where he plays a prominent role in the first and third parts of the miniseries, [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Destined Crossroad]] and [[Ultraman Trigger (series)|Ultraman Trigger: New Generation Tiga]], where he co-stars as a returning Ultra as part of a 2-part crossover with The Destined Crossroad (as well as heading up the concurrent "voice drama":[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwDaeL3aOb-z8gVFaB8awOotibdCCzbe8]).
other_names: ウルトラマンリブット

title: help:post_relationships
body:
h4. Parent and Child Posts

Parent and child posts, also known as [b]Post Relationships[/b], are a means of linking together groups of related posts. One post (normally the "best" version) is chosen to be the parent, while the other posts are made its children.

Parent/child relationships are typically used to group minor variants of the same image. Pools are another way of grouping posts; see the guidelines below for when to use a pool instead.

h6. Browsing

When viewing a post in a parent/child relationship, the other posts in the relationship are displayed as thumbnails at the top of the page. In search listings, parent posts are displayed with a green border, while child posts have a yellow border.

h6. Searching

Parent/child relationships may be searched using the {{parent:ID}}, {{parent:any}}, {{parent:none}}, {{child:any}}, or {{child:none}} metatags (see [[help:cheatsheet]]).

h6. Adding a parent

First, note the parent post's ID number. This is located under the [b]Information[/b] sidebar when viewing a post, or as part of the URL (e.g. /posts/1234).

Next, open the child post and click the [b]Edit[/b] link just below the image. Enter the post ID of the parent post in the [b]Parent[/b] field, then click [b]Submit[/b] to save your changes. Repeat this process for all child posts in the relationship.

You may also tag the post with the {{parent:ID}} or {{child:ID}} metatag, where ID is the post's ID number. This method can be used with [[help:tag scripts|tag scripts]] to quickly parent multiple posts.

h6. Removing a parent

Open the child post and click the [b]Edit[/b] link just below the image. Clear the [b]Parent[/b] field, then click [b]Submit[/b] to save your changes. Repeat for all other child posts in the relationship as necessary.

You may also tag the post with {{parent:none}} or {{-parent:ID}} to remove the parent.

To clear the same parent post from multiple children at once, tag the post with {{child:none}}.

h4. Guidelines

Generally, parent/child relationships should be used for minor variations of the same image. For comics or other series of posts meant to be viewed in order, use a [[help:pools|Pool]] instead.

h6. When TO use Post relationships

* When the same image is available in multiple resolutions or pixel sizes (see post #716608).
* When cropped and whole versions of the same image has been uploaded (see post #1540326)
* Derivatives of a Post, including setting variations (post #1544682) and costume variations (post #154471). See also post #625848 (hard translation and derivative character art) and post #55525 (smaller post and [[vector trace]]).
* When identical images from different sources have been uploaded. For which posts to set parent and child, see below.

h6. When NOT to use Post Relationships

For most other cases, it would be better to organize these images into a ([[help:pools|Pool]]). Examples include:

* Pages from a manga or doujin.
* Episodes of a comic.
* Any other series of posts intended to be viewed in order.
* Large collections of posts.

In such cases, Pools provide additional navigation features not available with Post Relationships.

h4. Choosing the Best Parent

The Parent Post should be considered in this order:

h6. For identical images

* [b]Most recent [u]active[/u] revision[/b]. There are exceptional cases where the latest revision is worse (ie, much smaller resolution, unless both are already [[absurdres]]) than the previous image (post #2645830). See [[MD5 mismatch]], [[revision]], and [[has bad revision]].
* [b]Highest resolution[/b]. If a picture has been [[upscaled]], the upscaled version should be the child.
* [b]Uncensored[/b]. Official [[uncensored]] versions (not to be confused with nude or third-party [[decensored]] versions) should be the parent, while censored ones should be children.
* [b]Highest quality[/b] (see [[jpeg_artifacts]], [[scan_artifacts]]). Prefer images with fewer artifacts. Larger filesize tends to mean higher quality, but not always.
* [b]Most lossless file format[/b] (png > jpg). See also [[lossy-lossless]], in the case a png is more lossy than its most original jpeg counterpart.
* [b]Most unaltered metadata[/b] for exactly identical images.
** In late 2020 Pixiv stripped metadata from [b]all[/b] of their pictures and recompressed most of them, so this line does not apply anymore to them - if the filesize is very close, they're often identical to the twitter equivalent and should not be uploaded if an already existing version with similar filesize is present onsite
** In fairly unique cases, the artist will have metadata present in an image from another site that needs to be manually checked.

* [b][[Image sample]]s[/b] should always be parented to their original image (and subsequently flagged and/or deleted).
* [b][[Duplicate]]s[/b] should be set as children of already existing posts when all the above criteria are identical in both pictures.
* Banned [b][[paid reward]]s[/b] should be set as the children of the lower-quality image, assuming it is on Danbooru.

h6. For derivative posts

* [b]Most original[/b], as opposed to confirmed derivatives.
* [b]Most exploitable[/b] variation of the post for creating derivatives.
* [b]Most complete[/b], as opposed to cropped posts.
* [b]Cleanest[/b], containing the least watermarking. In the case of third party [[detexted]] versions, the detexted one should be the child.

There might be exceptions with the above, for example if a picture is much higher resolution than its counterpart. If you are unsure which version should be the Parent, leave a comment on that Post or ask in the Forum.

h4. See also

* [[Help:Pools]]

title: vlad_iii_dracula
body:
Vlad III, Prince of Wallachia (1431–1476/77), was a member of the House of Drăculești, a branch of the House of Basarab, also known, using his patronymic, as Vlad Drăculea or Vlad Dracula (Old Church Slavonic: Владъ Дрьколъ). He was posthumously dubbed Vlad the Impaler (modern Romanian: Vlad Țepeș, pronounced [ˈvlad ˈt͡sepeʃ]) due to his habit of impaling his enemy's corpses. He is well known for his resistance against the [[Ottoman Empire]].

The name of the vampire Count [[Dracula]] in Bram Stoker's 1897 novel [i]Dracula[/i] was derived from William Wilkinson's book [i]An Account of the Principalities of Wallachia and Moldavia[/i], where he makes reference to both Vlad III and his father, Vlad II Dracul, as "Voïvode Dracula", with Stoker copying in his notes the footnote on the name, where it revealed its meaning of 'devil', and that it was given "as a surname to any person who rendered himself conspicuous either by courage, cruel actions, or cunning." This has inspired later authors, prior to Stoker's own notes becoming public, to associate the historical Vlad III with the vampire Count Dracula, with several Dracula-based fictions (e.g. [[Castlevania (series)|]] series, [[Hellsing]], etc.) regarding them as the same person, despite the original novel itself dismissing the association after introducing it later on.

h4.See also

* [[vlad_tepes_(eiyuu_senki)|Vlad Tepes]] ([[Eiyuu Senki]])
* [[vlad tepes (hellsing)|Vlad Tepes]] ([[Hellsing]])
* [[Vlad III (Fate/Apocrypha)]]
* [[Vlad III (Fate/Extra)]]
* [[vlad_iii_(moeoh_ex)|Vlad III (Moeoh EX)]]
* [[Tag Group:People]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler

body:

title: contemporary_traditional_clothes
body:
Clothes that are inspired by traditional folk wear, such as [[kimono]], [[hanfu]], [[slavic clothes]] (etc.) that have been modernized to fit [b]current day[/b] circumstances, or have been mix-matched with [[casual|modern clothes]]. Not to be used for [[fantasy]] or [[science fiction]] clothes inspired by traditional wear.

title: undone_necktie
body:
A [[necktie]] is untied or undone, but still worn around the neck. Not to be confused with [[loose necktie]]. If it is not worn around the neck, use [[unworn necktie]] instead.

Normally depicted with the undone clothing item hanging around the character's neck or clothing collar, with part hanging on each side of the character's torso.

title: daxiushan
body: Daxiushan, also referred as dianchailiyi, dashan or daxiu is a traditional Chinese upper garment, with broad long sleeves in Hanfu. It was most popular during the Tang dynasty, particularly among the members of royalty. it looks like a thin fabric [[cardigan]], without any closure. See [[beizi_(clothing)|]] for a similar hanfu garment [b]with[/b] a closure.

title: victor_van_dort_spraying_raid_and_screaming_(meme)
body:
[b]Victor Van Dort Spraying Raid and Screaming[/b] refers to a series of fan art redraws depicting characters from various fandoms spraying a can of Raid ant and roach killer towards the viewer while [[screaming]]. The redraws are based on a screenshot from a Maya Winky ASMR [[YouTube]] video where she cosplays as [[Victor Van Dort]] from [[Corpse Bride]] and were popularized on X, formerly [[Twitter]], in November 2023, spreading to sites like [[Tumblr]] that month.
h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Victor Van Dort Spraying Raid and Screaming":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/victor-van-dort-spraying-raid-and-screaming]

body: The 61st NHK [[Taiga Drama]] aired in 2022, featuring [[Houjou Yoshitoki]].

title: taiga_drama
body:
[[nhk (broadcaster)|NHK]]'s Sunday night program slot for year-long [[jidaigeki]] series.

Launched in the early days of Japanese television with the aim of creating Japan's best entertainment jidaigeki to rival movies, each Taiga Drama series is a big-budget production starring many big-name actors, considered the most prestigious among Japanese dramas. Running for around 50 episodes, each series usually focuses on one historical figure and depicts the era in depth through the life of that person, much like a roman-fleuve (thus [i]taiga[/i], which means "river" and so as "fleuve" in French).

h4. See also

* [[Dousuru Ieyasu]]
* [[Kamakura-dono no 13-nin]]
* [[Sanada Maru]]
* [[Taira no Kiyomori]]
* [[Yae no Sakura]]

title: sakurauchi_riko
body:
A protagonist in [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]. Riko is reserved, modest, and likes indoor activities, but often flies into a panic. She plays piano, collects manga (mostly yuri specializing in [[kabedon]] and [[hand on another's chin|kabekui]]) and lives with her [[sakurauchi riko's mother|mother]].

Riko is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[guilty kiss (love live!)|Guilty Kiss]], alongside [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] and [[Ohara Mari]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[red hair]], styled as a [[half updo]] with two [[hairclip]]s.

Voiced by [[Aida Rikako]].

title: watanabe_you
body:
[i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] character. An energetic student at Uranohoshi High who loves diving and sailing, often depicted in a [[competition swimsuit]] or other swimwear. Enjoys [[salute|saluting]] and using her catchphrase, "Yousoro!"

You is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[cyaron! (love live!)|CYaRon!]], alongside [[Takami Chika]] and [[Kurosawa Ruby]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] or [[grey hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. A childhood friend of [[Takami Chika]]. 

Voiced by [[Saitou Shuka]].

title: makai_senki_disgaea_7
body:
The seventh entry in the [[Disgaea]] franchise. The demonic realm of Hinomoto is changing and the days of noble warriors are numbered. Caught up in the commotion, the lazy samurai Fuji and bushido fangirl Pirilika find unlikely allies in each other as they fight against a tyrannical regime while discovering the meaning of honor and redemption!

Also known as [b]Disgaea 7: Vows of the Virtueless[/b] in the US

h4.Characters

* [[Ao (disgaea)|]]

* [[Fuji (disgaea)|]]
* [[Higan Zesshousai]]
* [[Pirilika (disgaea)|]]
* [[Suisen (disgaea)|]]
* [[Edogawa yeyasu]]
other_names: 魔界戦記ディスガイア7

title: daijuuji_kurou
body:
Protagonist of [[Demonbane]].

A financially poor detective and a former magic student at the Miskatonic University, Kurou is one day hired by the Hadou Financial Group to retrieve a powerful grimoire. In his search, he encounters the grimoire [[Al Azif (demonbane)|]], who bestows her power for him to utilize, becoming a magius, in order to fight members of the secretive Black Lodge. Although not a natural warrior, his strong sense of justice and morality allows him to effectively wield Al Azif's power and pilot the Deus Machina, [[Demonbane (mecha)|]].

title: another_blood
body: [[Demonbane]] character. Blood edition of the Necronomicon. The half-book, half human daughter of [[Daijuuji Kurou]] and [[Al Azif (demonbane)|]], and the sister and alternate universe counterpart of [[Daijuuji Kuzaku]].

title: al_azif_(demonbane)
body: [[Demonbane]] character. The original copy of the [[Necronomicon]], and likely the most powerful Grimoire when complete, usually takes the form of a young girl with lavendar hair and a white Gothic Lolita-style dress; she makes a pact with Kurou that allows him access to her power. Normally direct, bold and upbeat with a hint of surliness, she's also impatient with those who are slow to act in danger, yet also realizes when she or Kurou are outclassed. She sometimes refers to herself as [[daijuuji kurou|Kurou]]'s 'property' to tease him in front of others.

title: beavis
body: Beavis is a fictional character who serves as one of two protagonists from the MTV/Paramount+ animated series [[Beavis and Butt-Head]]. He is voiced by the show's creator, Mike Judge. In the movie Beavis and [[Butt-Head]] Do the Universe, Beavis' mother is referred to as "Shirley Beavis", implying that Beavis is actually the character's last name.

title: anthony_fantano
body: Anthony Nicholas Fantano (/fænˈtænoʊ/ fan-TAN-oh; born October 28, 1985) is an American music critic and internet personality who runs [[TheNeedleDrop]], a [[YouTube]] channel with a tie-in website and Twitch streaming channel. Self-appointed as "The Internet's Busiest Music Nerd", Fantano discusses and reviews music from a variety of genres online. He has a presence on X (formerly [[Twitter]]), where he discusses [[music]].

title: legend_of_mortal
body:
Legend of Mortal is an RPG published by Taiwanese developer Obb Studio and Chinese publisher Paras Games and first released on June 2024.

Player plays as [[Zhao Huo]], a third-rate disciple of the Tang-Man sect. As the world is in a turbulent sate, the player must choose his own destiny, to keep himself out of conflict or fight for the future of Tang-Man.

title: my_little_pony_(g3)
body: The third generation of [[My Little Pony]], from the 2000s.

title: my_little_pony_(g1)
body: The first generation of [[My Little Pony]], consisting of a toyline and various cartoons (My Little Pony 'n Friends, My Little Pony Tales) made in the 1980s.

title: spike_(my_little_pony)
body:
Spike is a young dragon and a secondary character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. He is [[Twilight Sparkle]]'s assistant and also a direct means of communication with [[Princess celestia|Princess Celestia]]. He can send letters instantly to Celestia by disintegrating them with his flame breath and receives letters from her by belching them out with his flames.

In terms of personality, he tries to act boyish and tough, but usually falls flat in his attempts. He's a bit of a glutton, he views Twilight as being like a surrogate mother to him, and he has a not-very-secret crush on [[Rarity (my little pony)|]].

title: flutterbat
body: Bat pony version of [[Fluttershy]] from the episode Bats! Typically portrayed as being [[vampire]]-like.

title: byalant_custom
body:
A fictional military manned robot from the [[Gundam]]  [[mecha]] verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]RX-160S Byarlant Custom[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] highly modified, modernized version of the aerospace combat [[Byalant]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], incorporating multiple elements from various [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] designs. Commanded by a veteran MS ace pilot who fought with the Titans, the unit devastated the invading "Sleeves" [[Neo Zeon]] forces at the Battle of Torrington.

title: torta
body:
A type of popular [[mexico|Mexican]] [[antojito]] [[sandwich]] usually made with [[meat]], [[chili pepper]]s, [[ham]], [[beans]], [[guacamole]], [[avocado]], [[tomato]], [[onion]], [[mustard]], [[mayonnaise]], [[sauce]], sour [[cream]] and other ingredients.

[[El Chavo]]'s favorite food.

title: el_chavo
body:
[b]El Chavo[/b] ([i]"The Kid"[/i]) is the main character of the [[mexico|Mexican]] live action TV comedy show [[El Chavo del Ocho]] ([i]"The Kid From The Eight"[/i]).

A kid with [[freckles]] who wears a green [[beanie]] [[hat]] with earflaps. He loves [[ham]] [[torta]]s and lives inside a [[barrel]].

Played by the same actor who plays [[El Chapulin Colorado]], "Roberto Gómez Bolaños, a.k.a. Chespirito":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito .

title: queen_chrysalis
body:
Major [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]] villain. She is the queen of the Changelings, a race of pony-like creatures with shapeshifting abilities who feed off love.

While the Changelings as a group are eventually reformed thanks to [[Thorax (my little pony)|]], Chrysalis rejects them and plots to regain control of her people.

title: princess_luna
body:
A secondary character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. She is [[Princess Celestia]]'s younger sister, and controls the night and moon.

* [b]English CV:[/b] Tabitha St. Germain

She also has [[green nails]]. Poette has a toggle to put on [[glasses]].

Her outfit consists of a [[green sweater|green]] [[turtleneck sweater]] [[sweater tucked in|tucked in]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket]], [[white pants]] and [[brown footwear|brown shoes]]. title: machine-doll_wa_kizutsukanai
body:
[i]Unbreakable Machine-Doll[/i]

A light novel series by Kaitou Reiji, with illustrations by [[Ruroo]]. It was adapted into an anime in 2013, and has a manga adaption by [[Takashiro Kei]]. title: transformers_armada
body:
The first [[Transformers]] series in the [[transformers unicron trilogy|Unicron Trilogy]]. It introduced the concept of [[minicon|minicons]] to the franchise and was followed by [i][[Transformers Energon]][/i].

The Japanese title is [i]Transformers Micron Densetsu[/i].


In 2023, Armada reaches its 20th Anniversary. In Transformers Legacy (toyline), Armada is known to be Armada Universe (アルマダユニバース in Japan) and still a part of Unicron Trilogy.

title: transformers_energon
body:
The second [[Transformers]] series in the [[transformers unicron trilogy|Unicron Trilogy]]. It is often considered one of the worst entries in the franchise by fans due to it's poor usage of CGI, bland characterizations, and toys hampered by gimmicks. It was preceded by [i][[Transformers Armada]][/i] and followed by [i][[Transformers Cybertron]][/i].

The Japanese title is [i]Transformers Superlink[/i].

title: transformers_cybertron
body:
The third [[Transformers]] series in the [[transformers unicron trilogy|Unicron Trilogy]]. It was preceded by [i][[Transformers Energon]][/i]. Due to the poor reception of it's predecessor, the show was originally made as a reboot in Japan, although the English dub added in cameos from the previous series' casts to continue with the original plan of the series being a continuation. It was later retconned into the Japanese version of the continuity in supplementary materials.

The Japanese title is [i]Transformers Galaxy Force[/i].
other_names: ギャラクシーフォース

title: oasis_(band)
body:
An English rock band that started in 1991 by the Gallagher brothers, Liam and his older brother Noel(vocalists), Paul "Bonehead" Arthurs(guitar), Paul "Guigsy" McGuigan(Bass guitar) and Tony McCarroll(drums). Often regarded as pioneers of the "Britpop" music scene. The band broke up in 2009 due to increasing animosity between the Gallagher brothers. Since the band's dissolution, Liam formed his owned Rock band called "Beady Eye" while Noel also form his own Rock band called "Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds".

In August 2024, it was announced the Gallagher brothers have reconcile and reform Oasis and will begin a new 2025 concert Tour in the UK and Ireland.

title: ars_goetia
body:
The Ars Goetia, otherwise known as the Lemegton or The Lesser Key of Solomon, is a 17th-century grimoire describing 72 demons that Solomon is said to have evoked and confined within brass seals. All of them are given ranks, alignments, abilities, characteristics, and specific summoning instructions.

Examples in modern media are the Great Demons [[Gaap (umineko)|]], [[Ronove (umineko)|]], [[Furfur]] and [[Zepar]] in [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Lesser Key of Solomon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lesser_Key_of_Solomon]

title: dragon_ball:_sparking!
body:
[[Dragon Ball]] fighting game series, debuting on the PlayStation 2 in 2005. In English, the games were referred to as the [i]Budokai Tenkaichi[/i] series, building off of the localized title for the otherwise-unrelated [i]Budokai[/i] series of Dragon Ball fighting games (known in Japanese as just the [i]Dragon Ball Z[/i] fighting game series). The [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]] games served as spiritual successors to the series (after [i]Burst Limit[/i] and the [i]Raging Blast[/i] series), until its return in 2024 with Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero.

Alongside featuring playable recreations of the events of [[Dragon Ball Z]], its movies, [[Dragon Ball GT|GT]], and [[Dragon Ball Super|Super]], each game features unique playable 'what if' events.

title: klavier_gavin
body:
[[Kristoph Gavin]]'s younger brother and [[Apollo Justice]]'s rival. Klavier is a prosecuting attorney who learned his trade at age 17 in Europe, and is interested in Apollo because [spoiler]he got his famous brother tried for murder.[/spoiler]

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] which is usually styled into a [[twisted hair|twist]] worn [[hair over shoulder|over his shoulder]].

He usually wears a [[single earring|single]] [[earrings|earring]] a [[chain necklace|chain]] [[necklace]] featuring his band's logo,, an [[open jacket|open]] [[purple jacket|purple]] [[jacket]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[lapels]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[shirt]] with an [[open collar|open]] [[popped collar|popped]] [[collared shirt|collar]] (that he wears in such a way that exposes a bit of his [[midriff peek|stomach]]), a set of [[multiple rings|rin]][[ring|gs]] on his fingers (including a [[thumb ring]]), a [[belt chain]] and a [[chain belt|chain]] [[belt]], a pair of [[black pants|black]] [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[shoes]].

When he was seventeen, his hair was [[short hair|short]], and he wore [[sunglasses]], a black shirt with [[buttons]], a [[print shirt|print]] and [[sleeve cuffs]], a pair of black pants with [[pocket]]s and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[boots]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Garyuu Kyouya

title: apollo_justice
body:
The player character of [i]Apollo Justice: [[Ace Attorney]][/i], he is a novice defense attorney initially under [[Kristoph Gavin]]'s mentorship. Afterwards, Apollo meets a hoodlum [[Phoenix Wright]] and his adopted daughter [[Trucy Wright|Trucy]] and starts a makeshift attorney's office with Trucy. He returns in [i][[Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies]][/i] wearing bandages and a jacket over his shoulders, and is more mature-looking than before.

Apollo has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[antenna hair|antennae locks]] on top, [[forked eyebrows]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

He usually wears a [[red vest|red]] [[vest]] with [[buttons]], [[lapels]] and [[pockets]]; a [[lapel pin]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt]] with [[sleeves rolled up]], a [[bracelet]], an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] or [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], a [[black belt|black]] [[belt]], a pair of [[red pants|red]] [[pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: super_yamato
body:
A planned class of battleships of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], developing during the [[world war ii|Second World War]]. Generally referred to by its plan number of A-150 in English, in Japanese they are popularly referred to as the [b]Super Yamato-class[/b] battleships. The war would end before a ship could begin formal construction, and to maintain its secrecy, many details on its design were destroyed.

As a result of the loss of significant formal information on the Super Yamato, much speculation exists on the exact specifications of the battleship, though what information exists has led speculation on it contending for the title of the "most powerful battleships in history" if built, such as its main battery of six 45-caliber 51cm guns in three twin turrets, dwarfing the [[Yamato (battleship)|]]-class' 46cm guns. In turn, due to the Yamato-class consisting of the largest battleships ever commissioned, it is generally believed that the Super Yamato-class battleships would have been even larger.

Despite only existing in concept, the Super Yamato has made appearances in media. [[World of Warships]] features the design in three ships currently in the game: the Izumo (an early A-150s design), Shikishima (initially called the Yashima, and is unrelated to the Shikishima-class battleship), and Satsuma (a further development of the A-150 design). It makes an appearance in [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 6|Yakuza 6]] as [spoiler]the "Secret of Onomichi", the project not being scrapped and it continuing production using embezzled money, with the English translation naming it the "Yamato Mark II"[/spoiler]. She appears in [[Warship Girls R]] with the name [[A150 (warship girls r)|]], with her enemy counterpart baring the name [[enemy a150 (warship girls r)|Cyou-yamato]]. Some appearances utilize the names theorized by journalist Itou Masanori, being "Kii" (紀伊) or "Owari" (尾張), potentially inheriting the name(s) of the similarly-planned Kii-class battleships (though this is speculation entirely based on battleship naming conventions) - an example can be found with Fujimi's model ships, releasing the 'phantom battleship' Kii.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Design A-150 battleship":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Design_A-150_battleship

title: scarlet_police
body:
Several Touhou songs by [[IOSYS]], covering [[Remilia Scarlet]] deciding to act as a police officer in Gensokyo. 

"Scarlet Police on Ghetto Patrol 24/7":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7h7bnYA1LXE] is the first song, and is the most popular. It features Remilia and [[Cirno]] engaged in a rap and dance battle, and is the origin of the Funky meme. 
* !post #5366740
"Electricity has stopped! At Scarlet Call":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xcGd_NZaZKw] is the second song, and features the Scarlet Police working an emergency line. 

The Scarlet Police outfits worn by Remilia, Sakuya, and Patchouli have become common themes wherever a police officer is needed. Cirno's first part in Ghetto Patrol has also become a popular meme for the character.

title: fish_mint_(plant)
body:
[b][i]Houttuynia cordata[/i][/b] is a [[flower]]ing plant native to moist and shady regions of Southeast Asia. The plant has many common names, some of which are: [b]chameleon plant[/b], [b]Chinese lizard tail[/b], [b]fish leaf[/b], [b]fish mint[/b], [b]fish wort[/b], [b]heart leaf[/b], and [b]rainbow plant[/b].

The flowers have four to six petals with a tall spike in the center, although the "petals" are actually bracts (petal-like leaves) and the true flowers grow on the spike. The leaves are cordate (heart-shaped).

Houttuynia is used in cooking and medicine throughout Asia. The leaves have a fishy smell and taste, earning the plant one of its common names, fish mint.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23491789: Photo reference
* !post #3192706
* !post #6087096

h4. See also
* [[Dogwood (flower)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Houttuynia cordata":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Houttuynia_cordata
* "Wikipedia (JP): Houttuynia cordata (Dokudami)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ドクダミ
* "Wikipedia: Saururaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saururaceae

title: taur
body:
A character having the full body of an animal, but with a humanoid torso where the animal's head would be.

[[Lamia]]s, [[harpy|harpies]], [[mermaid]]s and similar [b]usually[/b] do not apply, because their lower body is not a full monster body. There are exceptions (see below).

h4. Common Types:
* [[centaur]], humanoid torso on horse body
* [[arachne]], female humanoid torso on spider body
* certain depictions of [[sphinx]]es
* certain depictions of [[arthropod girl]]s and [[arthropod boy|boy]]s
* [[centauroid]], umbrella tag for centaur-like animals that are not horses (goats, deers, etc)

h4. Examples of uncommon types that still qualify for this tag
* !post #1004239: mecha taur 
* !post #4021268: golem taur
* !post #4405129: whale taur (note that the lower body is a complete whale body, unlike most mermaids)

title: ecclesia_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] Ecclesia is one of the protagonists of the Abyss Storyline alongside [[Albaz (yu-gi-oh!)|]]. Looks up to [[Fleurdelis (yu-gi-oh!)|]] as her idol. She wields a large [[war hammer]] in combat. Her hairstyle changes over the course of the story to show her development.

One of her defining characteristics is that she's the [[glutton|type to eat big meals]]. With a popular running gag within the Yu-Gi-Oh! fanbase revolves around her trying to eat anything that remotely looks like a food, including other duel monsters. This has reached the point that a Pixiv tag "ごはんはたくさんたべるタイプ" ("a type to eat big meals") was dedicated to her. 

This tag has become so memetic, the concept artist for Live Twin Lil-la Treat references it in a conversation between [[lil-la_(yu-gi-oh!)|Lil-la]] and [[ki-sikil_(yu-gi-oh!)|Ki-sikil]].

h4. Variants
* [[Dogmatika Ecclesia the Virtuous]] - The original, wears [[armor]], has a [[war hammer]] 
* [[Incredible Ecclesia the Virtuous]] - [[Ponytail]], [[goggles]], [[suspender shorts]], [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[skull]] [[war hammer]]
* [[Blazing Cartesia the Virtuous]]
* [[New Frontier (yu-gi-oh!)|]]
* [[Ecclesia the Exiled]]
other_names: ごはんはたくさんたべるタイプ

title: inaba_tewi
body:
The "Earth-Rabbit", Stage 5 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i], and later a playable character in [i][[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]][/i]. A [[rabbit girl|rabbit]] youkai with the power to bring good fortune to humans, often leading them out of or through the [[bamboo forest]] and into [[Eientei]], where she also serves as de facto leader of the [[inaba mob (touhou)|earth-rabbits]]. Known for her playful and at times mischievous personality.

She is occasionally depicted wielding a [[kine]] mallet, normally used to pound rice into [[mochi]].

Possibly the [[Hare of Inaba]] from the ancient Kojiki, the oldest book of Japan's written legends. This would make her one of the oldest living beings in Gensokyo.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23489643

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]] that is often [[wavy hair|wavy]], [[red eyes]], and [[floppy ears|floppy]] [[rabbit ears]]. Her outfit is a simple [[pink dress]] with [[frilled dress|frills]] and a [[ribbon-trimmed dress|ribbon trim]] on the hem with [[puffy short sleeves|puffy]] [[frilled sleeves]], sometimes with her [[rabbit tail|tail]] out. Her signature accessory is her [[carrot necklace]] and she often goes [[barefoot]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Tewi Inaba":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Tewi_Inaba

title: manchu_clothes
body: Also known as Qizhuang , lit. 'Banner Dress' - or Manfu, lit. 'Manchu clothes'. Traditional clothing of the Manchu people in China. h4. Examples of Manchu clothing h5. Outfits h6. Paofu (袍服) Any type of traditional robe; all one-piece and long in design. Also known as Pao [tn](袍)[/tn]. * [[Changpao]] (長袍): A robe, worn by men; the Han Chinese changshan is an offshoot of this. * Chenyi (衬衣): A type of dress * Jifu (吉服): Worn for fesitive occasions. Subtypes includes the Jifupao (吉服袍), and the longgua (or jifugua) (吉服褂). h5. Headwear * [[Qitou]] (旗头): A traditional headwear or hairstyle that crests over the crown of the head, with subtypes including the [[liangbatou]] and [[dalachi_(headdress)|]]. h5. Misc. * Matixiu (马蹄袖); lit. 'horseshoe sleeves'; semi-wide sleeves that distinctly taper inwards at the bottom. H4. Footwear * [[Qixie]]

title: propane_tank
body:
A common type of [[gas cylinder]] designed to contain [[flammable symbol|flammable]] gases like LPG (commonly propane and butane) generally intended for domestic/outdoor [[cooking]] and heating fuel. This tag should be used for the "portable propane cylinders":[/posts/1850700] larger than portable stove "fuel canisters":[/posts/4143518], but smaller than the huge fixed [[tank (container)|pill-shaped tanks]] installed outside a building ("example":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Berry_Town_Hall%27s_Propane_Tank_-_panoramio.jpg]). 

Propane tanks are identifiable by its stubby shape, the presence of a metal protective collar or neck ring around the valve at the top of the canister, a huge carry handle, and a metal foot ring on the bottom.

h4. Examples
* !post #7491784
* !post #8072244

title: changpao
body:
It means "long shirt", and is the male equivalent of a female cheongsam (qipao). It has a [[mandarin collar]] and often [[side slit]]s. It is a type of [[manchu clothes|manchu clothing]].

Not to be confused with [[yuanlingpao]], which is hanfu and doesn't necessarily have a [[mandarin collar]]. When it does have one, it is layered.

title: bonbon_(my_little_pony)
body:
A background character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]] who has curly pink and dark blue hair, often depicted with [[Lyra Heartstrings]].

In fan works, she is portrayed as being calm and conservative in her actions, and tries to keep Lyra's obsessions from getting out of hand. She has a different voice actress every time she has a speaking role.

In the hundredth episode of the series, she revealed herself to be former secret agent Sweetie Drops, and also seemed to have a very close and affectionate friendship with Lyra. In the background of several episodes it is shown that the two are a couple, with one scene showing them proposing to each other and then a wedding photo appearing in a newspaper.
other_names: ボンボン(マイリトルポニー)

title: lyra_heartstrings
body:
A minty green unicorn who is a background character in [[My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic]]. She is often depicted with [[Bonbon (my little pony)|]].

Fans depict her as having an expressive and hyperactive personality as well as an obsession with humans and hands. In the show, she has been seen jumping and grinning madly while staring at the viewer in many crowd shots, as if trying to get the viewer's attention, and has a tendency to behave in a human-like manner (trying to hold things with her hooves, slouching on a bench instead of laying on her belly.)

She and Bonbon were shown to have a very close and affectionate friendship in the background pony-oriented hundredth episode. In the background of several episodes it is shown that the two are a couple, with one scene showing them proposing to each other and then a wedding photo appearing in a newspaper.
other_names: ライラ・ハートストリングス

title: zephiel_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Zephiel[/b] (known as [b]Zefhyr[/b] in Japanese) is the talented but ruthless king of Bern from [[Fire Emblem: The Binding Blade]]. He intends to conquer all of Elibe to free Dragonkind, allowing them to dominate over humanity.

He has [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[short hair]] with a [[circlet]], wears [[purple armor|purple]] [[armor]] with a [[purple cape|purple]], [[fur trim|fur-trimmed]] [[cape]], and wields a transformable [[sword]] called Eckesachs. Due to his battle animation, he is jokingly referred to as "the spinning king".

A younger, innocent version of him appeared in [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]].
other_names: ゼフィール(ファイアーエムブレム)

title: water
body:
A colorless, tasteless inorganic compound with chemical formula H₂O, vital to entire life forms on Earth.

This only applies to water being clearly visible in its liquid state.

title: drag_queen
body:
A performer, usually male, who uses clothing and makeup to exaggerate female gender roles and femininity for the purpose of entertainment or expression. 

Drag makeup and clothing are usually flashy and overly flamboyant, intentionally drawing attention to the wearer. Queens usually perform in drag shows for the entertainment of the audience, usually featuring lip-syncing and dancing.

While the art is traditionally associated with [[crossdressing]], some women (both cis and trans) also participate in the activity. [[Chappell Roan (person)|]] is a good example of a cisgender woman who often dresses in drag in her performances.

h4. See also

title: life_heart_(traffic_life)
body:
[[Heart]] symbol in the [[Traffic Life series]] that represents how many lives a character has left. Comes in three varieties: green, yellow, and red.

May be depicted in different ways by different artists and depending on the season: [[Limited Life SMP]] art often depicts it as part of a pocket watch, while in general many artists often depict it as a tattoo on the body or as a literal life meter.

It is also commonly used in a full red-yellow-green "traffic light" design to represent the series as a whole.

h4. See also

* [[Hardcore Heart]]

title: pear_blossom
body: Pear blossom, belonging to the genus Pyrus in the Rosaceae family, refers to the flowers of the pear tree. The pear tree is a deciduous tree with leaves that are round like those of the large-leaved poplar, and its trunk is covered with thick bark, while its branches spread out like an umbrella. It blooms in spring, with flowers that are pure white, resembling snowflakes, and emitting a faint fragrance. Pears can be eaten raw, as well as used for making wine, pear syrup, pear preserves, and for medicinal purposes. The cultivation history of pear blossoms in China spans over 2000 years.

title: savanna_striped_giant_slug_(kemono_friends)
body:
Comedic depictions of [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i]' [[plains_zebra_(kemono_friends)|Plains Zebra]] as a giant slug, or of a creature independent from Plains Zebra. The Savanna Striped Giant Slug is a simple-shaped, white slug-like blob with black zebra stripes, its size most typically varying from palm-sized to Friend-sized to horse-sized.

The gag stems from Plains Zebra's cameo in the original anime run, wherein she is seen only from behind, at a distance, and as obscured by tall grass, leaving only her very long, striped hair and ears visible; the resulting silhouette resembles a white, stripey slug-like blob, resulting in fan art of the apparent slug creature and nicknames such as [i]Plains Zebra-striped giant slug[/i] being given to Plains Zebra. It can be seen as a background element in various Kemono Friends fan art works, often hiding in tall grass as per its origins.

Frequently paired with [[jaguar_(kemono_friends)|Jaguar]] in fan art.

Often involves [[female orgasm]] or [[female ejaculation]].
Doesn't have to result in [[stomach bulge]].

h4. Note

The stimulation should not be caused coincidentally by a [[vaginal object insertion]] that also stimulates other parts of the vagina (e.g. the mere presence of a penis, vibrator, hand, etc).

The tag would technically fit posts that show only the outside of the body in a way that implies g-spot stimulation (example: post #8168641), but searching and tagging existing posts would involve a lot of work (>10k posts).

body:

title: ariane_yeong
body:
The Gestalt pilot and officer of [[spacecraft|Penrose-512]]. After their ship crashlands on the frozen planet Leng, her [[Android|Replika]] crewmate [[Elster (signalis)|Elster]] goes in search of her throughout Sierpinski.

[Spoiler] It's eventually revealed that Ariane and [[Elster (signalis)|Elster]] are lovers, and that [[Elster (signalis)|Elster's]] search for Ariane is to fulfil an unknown promise the two of them previously made onboard the Penrose. 

It's additionally revealed that Ariane is Bioresonant, and heavily implied that much (if not all) of the games events and story are caused by her bioresonant abilities.

title: kanami_kaito
body:
A former [[Virtual YouTuber]] from [[NEXAS (vtuber)|]]' second generation. Character design by [[Nihakusanren]]. Shares the same designer with [[Faelie Fallwood]] and [[Cora Light]]. Her debut was postponed twice due to personal reasons, in which she ended up debuting on August 26, 2024 instead.

On September 23, 2024, Kanami announced that she would graduate from NEXAS the day after.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[brown hair]] with [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[cat ears]], a [[blue hairband]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[slit pupils]].

Her outfit consists of a [[brown]] [[cropped shirt]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], [[black gloves]], a [[brown bag]] with many items including a [[scale]], a [[lantern]] and a [[scroll]], [[brown pants|brown]] [[puffy pants]], [[white socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: jeff_albertson
body: Jeff Albertson, commonly known as the Comic Book Guy (CBG), is a recurring fictional character in the animated television series [[The Simpsons]] and Eisner-nominated spin-off comic book series Comic Book Guy. He is voiced by Hank Azaria and first appeared in the second-season episode "Three Men and a Comic Book", which originally aired on May 9, 1991. Comic Book Guy is the proprietor of a comic book store, The Android's Dungeon & Baseball Card Shop. He is based on "every comic book store guy in America" and represents a stereotypical middle-aged comic-book collector with a supercilious attitude and obsessive knowledge of pop culture minutia. He is known for his distinctive accent, disagreeable personality, and his catchphrase, "Worst [thing] ever!"

title: roger_(american_dad)
body: Roger Smith is a fictional character in the adult animated sitcom [[American Dad!]], created, voiced, and designed by Seth MacFarlane. Roger is a grey space [[alien]] living with the Smith family. Having lived on Earth since crashing in Roswell, New Mexico in 1947, Roger came to live with the Smiths after rescuing main character [[Stan Smith]] at Area 51 four years prior to the beginning of the series. The character has also made cameo appearances in episodes of [[Family Guy]].

* !post #7593315

title: tamaki_(voisona)
body:
Tamaki is a Japanese vocal synthesizer for [[VoiSona]].

Her voice is provided by [[Inuyama Tamaki]].

"Tamaki" is a character born from the concept of envisioning what would happen if the virtual YouTuber "Inuyama Tamaki" were born female and pursued a life dedicated to singing. title: cuphead_(game)
body:
Run and gun video game developed by StudioMDHR and released in 2017 for the [[Xbox One]] and PC. It later released on [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[PlayStation 4]] in 2019 and 2020 respectively. A DLC campaign titled "The Delicious Last Course" and a [[Netflix]] animated show released in 2022.

The game is in the style of a [[1930s (style)|]] cartoon, inspired by the works of Max Fleischer and [[Walt Disney]].

The player plays as [[Cuphead]], who fights a series of bosses in order to repay a debt to [[the Devil (cuphead)|]]. The game has been noted for its challenging difficulty.
H4. External links
* "Official website":https://cuphead.iam8bit.com/
* "Wikipedia Article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuphead

title: pyro_(tf2)
body:
[i]I fear no man. But that thing, it scares me.[/i]
--[[Heavy (tf2)|]], talking about the Pyro

One of the playable classes in [[Team Fortress 2]].

An enigmatic, insane, fire-obsessed figure who has never been seen without their full body suit and voice-obscuring mask, the Pyro's name, nationality, [[ambiguous gender|gender]] and even species are a mystery, with the game's developers intentionally teasing the community for years about the truth. Supplementary materials have revealed that the Pyro sees the world in "Pyrovision", where everything is colored with pastels and rainbows, and the Pyro sees themselves merrily bringing joy to others when in reality they're causing untold, horrific suffering. Although childlike, crazy, and terrifying, the Pyro has been shown to act amiably to their teammates on occasion, especially [[Engineer (tf2)|the Engineer]].

The Pyro has average speed and health, and primarily wields a home-made [[flamethrower]], a [[shotgun]] and a [[fire axe]]. They can also use a [[flare gun]], a [[jetpack]], a thrown canister of [[gasoline]], and various alternative versions of each. They're also known for being the natural enemy of [[Spy (tf2)|the Spy]].

The Pyro normally wears a team-colored, full-body fire-retardant rubber suit, a [[gas mask]], large rubber [[gloves]], black belts and boots, and an [[oxygen tank]] on their back.

title: lovebrush_chronicles
body:
[i]Lovebrush Chronicles[/i], known as [i]For All Time[/i] in its native Chinese, is a mobile otome game by PC and mobile game company NetEase Interactive Entertainment. It received an English localization on October 20th, 2023 for Android and iOS devices. 

The player plays as an art major freshman at St. Shelter Academia and the author behind the popular manga "In Passing", who soon finds out that she has the ability to travel to different dimensions and summon her own arts for combat after being sent to Godheim - the world featured in her manga. In these parallel universes, their inhabitants are incarnations of the people from your world. From then on, you embarks on an endless voyage across time and space to learn the truth and protect what you hold dear alongside or against familiar faces. 

The game combines story-driven visual novel with adventure and RPG elements. Outside of the main storyline, the player can spend time with the love interests with various activities or working to increase your reputation in school.

body:

* !post #7672013

See [[droopy ears]] for ears naturally pointed downwards.
See [[single ear down]] if only one ear is pointed downwards.
Use [[floppy ears]] if the ears are flat against the head.

title: droopy_ears
body:
When non-human ears are naturally pointed downwards.

Use [[single ear down]] if only one ear is drooping.

title: guan_hat
body:
Guan is broad term for any type of hat in of [[Hanfu]] headwear. It tends to cover the full top of the head; for Hanfu headwear that only covers the [[topknot]], see [[Xiao Guan (headdress)|]].

Please see the subtypes and use them instead, as guan is unspecific. 

The Guan was typically a formal form of headwear which was worn together with its corresponding court dress attire. There were sumptuary laws which regulated the wearing of Guan; however, these laws were not fixed; and thus, they would differ from dynasty to dynasty. There were various forms and types of Guan.

As the character Guan (冠) is of a homonym another Chinese character pronounced Guan (官) which literally means official; the Guan (冠) became the symbol of officials. Note, this should not be confused with [[futou]] which essentially replaced the Guan as Chinese court wear around the [[Tang dynasty]] (but continued to be worn by Confucian literati until the [[Ming dynasty]], where it became the exclusive headwear of the royal family).

h4. Subtypes
** [[Fengguan]] - Women's headgear for official events, ceremonies, and weddings
** [[Mian guan]] - Emperor's hat
** [[Xiezhi guan]] - Hat once worn by lawyers.
** [[Yuanyou Guan]]

h4. See also

title: winston_zeddemore
body: Winston Zeddemore, PhD is a fictional character appearing in the [[Ghostbusters]] films, TV series, and video games. He is played by Ernie Hudson in the films Ghostbusters, Ghostbusters II, Ghostbusters: Afterlife and Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire and was voiced by Arsenio Hall in the first three seasons of [[The Real Ghostbusters]]. Buster Jones provided Winston's voice in the remaining seasons, and he reprised the role in a cameo on [[Extreme Ghostbusters]]. Hudson returned to provide his appearance and voice to Zeddemore in 2009's Ghostbusters: The Video Game and 2022's Ghostbusters: Spirits Unleashed.

title: buffering
body:
A common computer graphic consisting of a series of dots, ovals or lines arranged in a circle, and either progressively shaded from light to dark or increasing in size. When animated the formation appears to rotate.

It typically appears when an application is waiting for data (for example, waiting to receive the next few seconds of a streamed video). It can also appear when the system is busy doing something; in this sense it is equivalent to the older spinning hourglass icon.

When applied to a character, it usually indicates:
* an imminent realization regarding a mistake they made or something they forgot
* an inability to fully grasp something that has just happened
* a vacant mental state ("no thoughts, head empty")

h4. See Also
* [[...]]
* [[spoken ellipsis]]
* [[nurupo (meme)|]]

It comes from the fact that due to a bug in [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]], Merlin would act improperly during the Prismriver's final spell card. This cause fans to portray her as crazy or rebellious.

title: groundhog_day
body: Groundhog Day is a 1993 American fantasy romantic comedy film directed by [[Harold Ramis]] from a screenplay by him and Danny Rubin. Starring [[Bill Murray]], Andie MacDowell, and Chris Elliott, it tells the story of a cynical television weatherman covering the annual [[Groundhog Day]] event in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, who becomes trapped in a time loop, forcing him to relive February 2 repeatedly.

title: harold_ramis
body: Harold Allen Ramis (/ˈreɪmɪs/; November 21, 1944 – February 24, 2014) was an actor, comedian, and filmmaker. His film acting roles include [[Egon Spengler]] in [[Ghostbusters]] (1984) and Ghostbusters II (1989), and as Russell Ziskey in Stripes (1981); he also co-wrote those films. As a director, his films include the comedies Caddyshack (1980), National Lampoon's Vacation (1983), [[Groundhog Day]] (1993), Analyze This (1999) and Analyze That (2002).

title: han_juri
body:
[b]Han Juri[/b] ([i]katakana[/i]: [b]ハン・ジュリ[/b], [i]hangul[/i]: [b]한주리[/b]) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. She makes her debut in [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Super Street Fighter IV]]. She is the first [[Korea|Korean]] character in the Street Fighter series, and the only one that uses [[Taekwondo]] so far. She is voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]] in Japanese and Jessica Strauss in English.

She is described as being an "evil, mean and nasty" member of S.I.N. who is a main character in the SFIV storyline. The character was created by request of many Korean fans who wished for [[Capcom]] to add a Korean character in Street Fighter, something already established by [[SNK]] and [[Namco]]. 

She is depicted as being overtly [[sadism|sadistic]] and often makes denigrating and [[sexually suggestive]] remarks toward her opponents. [spoiler]According to [[Menat]], this cruel demeanor is simply a facade to hide her emotional pain and suffering as a result of her traumatic experience after her parents were killed by [[m. bison|M. Bison]], who blinded her left eye, along with her mistreatment after she was captured as a test subject by Shadaloo and S.I.N.[/spoiler]

Juri's left eye was replaced with a "Feng Shui engine," a device capable of enhancing one's power with ki energy, in which she typically covered it with her [[eyepatch]] or [[diagonal bangs]]. Normally, she has [[purple eyes]], but she may appear as a [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] when she uses the Feng Shui engine in her left eye, causing it to become [[blue eyes|blue]].

Ironically, Juri is initially met with negative reception from some Korean fanbases, primarily due to her "non-authentic" appearance, albeit these negative connotations would be dissipated afterwards. Her creation is also seen as a rib to [[The King of Fighters]] as all the Korean characters in that franchise, particularly [[Kim Kaphwan]], are either representatives of Justice or evildoers who redeem themselves, while she is (at least initially) a servant of evil. 

h4. Known moves

* Fuhajin
** Fuharenjin

* Shikusen
** [[Street Fighter III (series)|2nd Impact]]
*** [[street_fighter_iii_(series)|3rd Strike]]

* Senpusha
** Kaisen Dankairaku

* Kasatsushi

* Feng Shui Engine
other_names: ジュリ(ストリートファイター)

title: dianzi
body: Traditional Chinese hat of the [[Manchu clothes|Manchurian people]]. It's semicircular in shape, reminiscent of a [[kepi]] or [[cabbie hat]], with its visor. However, some versions do not have a visor. Its literal translation is hat ring. It's often a made up of a metal frame, adorned with materials like silk or rattan. Common patterns on the dianzi includes dragons, phoenixes, butterflies, bats, flowers and clouds. It was often worn over [[liangbatou]], to protect the hairstyle. It is hat, so tiara shaped hair ornaments/hairbands may be better described as [[dalachi_(headdress)|]] or [[fengguan]]. h4. Examples * !post #7796708 * !post #7220180: Dianzi with [[lappet]]s (hat flaps). h4. See also * [[Dalachi_(headdress)|]] * [[Fengguan]] * [[Kokoshnik]] * [[Zhuang hat]] h4. External links * "Westca forums (Photo examples of the dianzi)":[https://www.westca.com/pda/forums/op=view_next/t=1182713/lang=schinese.html#0]

title: nijigasaki_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Nijigasaki High School (虹ヶ咲学園) in [[Love Live! School idol festival]] and [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. It comes in 2 main variants; a winter version and a summer version. Additionally, most characters add personal touches to their uniform, like omitting or replacing certain pieces, adding extra layers, etc. Specific changes to the uniform are listed on the respective character's page.

The [[winter uniform]] consists of the following:
* [[black jacket|black]] [[jacket]] with golden [[buttons]]
* [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]]
* [[grey skirt|grey]] or [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]]

The [[summer uniform]] consists of:
* [[black vest|black]] [[vest]] or [[yellow sweater vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]]
* [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] or [[blue shirt|light blue]] [[collared shirt]]
* [[blue skirt|navy blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]]

Both versions feature a [[neck ribbon]] which is a different color depending on the grade ([[yellow ribbon|yellow]] for first years, [[red ribbon|red]] second years , and [[green ribbon|green]] for third years)

h4. Examples
* !post #5649100: Winter uniform
* !post #6294183: Summer uniform

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] and a [[short dress|short]] [[grey dress|grey]] [[pinafore dress]]. The [[winter uniform]] has an [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[jacket]] and the shirt is [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], while in the [[summer uniform]] there is no jacket and the shirt is [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]].

She has matching [[light blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]], her canon height is 158 cm (or 5'2"), she weight 48kg (or 106lbs) and her canon measurements are bust:88(F)/waist:59/hip:85.

She used to work as a farm hand at a ranch near the Onsen Town, but later transferred to the Black Lily Ranch to share her expertise. 

She first appeared in the chapter 33 of [[monster musume no iru nichijou]]

title: linkin_park
body:
An American alternative rock band from [[California]].

The band is currently composed of [[Michael Kenji Shinoda|Mike Shinoda]] (vocals, keyboard, piano), Emily Armstrong (vocals), [[Bradford Phillip Delson|Brad Delson]] (guitar), Colin Brittain (drums), [[David Michael Farrell|Dave Farrell]] (bass), and [[Joseph Hahn|Joe Hahn]] (DJ, sampler, programing).

[[Chester Charles Bennington|Chester Bennington]], one of the band's lead vocalists, passed away on July 20, 2017 after committing suicide. Emily Armstrong would later take on the role of co-lead vocalist after the band's reformation in September of 2024. Drummer [[Rob Bourdon]] left the band prior to their reformation, being replaced by Colin Brittain.

title: the_hunger_games
body:
A trilogy of sci-fi novels by Suzanne Collins. The series is set in the dystopian future country Panem (located in North America and encompassing the territories of the real-life countries Canada, the USA and Mexico), where 12 districts must send 2 tributes (one male and one female) to the titular Hunger Games, a yearly battle royale to the death.

The books were adapted into live action films released from 2012 to 2015.

title: wallace_wells
body: [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] character. Introduced as [[scott pilgrim|Scott]]'s "cool gay roommate" that he mooches off and serves as the snarky voice of reason. Hooks up with various male characters, though also appears to have had feelings for Scott at some point. Often gossips with (and steals the boyfriends of) Scott's sister [[stacey pilgrim|Stacey]]. Almost always has a [[jitome]] expression or [[smug]] look on his face, and commonly seen with a [[martini]] in hand. In the [[scott pilgrim takes off|anime]], he plays himself in [[neil nordegraf|Young Neil]]'s movie after heckling the old actor (who he describes as a "notorious heterosexual", a meta gag to Kieran Culkin) too much, and ends up having an on-set fling with [[Todd Ingram]], with the running gag being that Todd is dressed as Scott, who he's playing in the movie. title: tsuchinoko
body:
The Tsuchinoko meaning "hammerspawn", is a legendary [[snake]]-like cryptid from Japan. The name [i]tsuchinoko[/i] is prevalent in Western Japan, including Kansai and Shikoku; the creature is known as [i]bachi hebi[/i] in Northeastern Japan.

Tsuchinoko are described as being between 30 and 80 centimeters in length, similar in appearance to a snake, but with a central girth that is much wider than its head or [[snake tail|tail]], and as having [[fangs]] and venom similar to that of a viper.

[[Kirisame Marisa]] adopts the tsuchinoko found in [i][[Eastern and Little Nature Deity]][/i] as a pet.

For the [[Youkai Watch]] character, see [[Tsuchinoko (Youkai Watch)]]. For the [[Kemono Friends]] character, see [[Tsuchinoko (Kemono Friends)]]. For the [[Bocchi the Rock!]] character, see [[Gotoh Hitori (Tsuchinoko)]].

title: scott_pilgrim
body:
Protagonist of the [[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]] series. A nerdy guy in his early 20s who is generally cheerful and friendly towards other characters. Lives with his gay college friend [[wallace wells|Wallace]] and mostly mooches off him, though Wallace doesn't seem to mind. Plays in a band called Sex Bomb-omb.

He keeps seeing a mysterious girl in his dreams, and it later turns out that she's real, and her name is [[Ramona Flowers]]. In order to win Ramona's love, Scott must defeat her seven "evil exes".

He has short [[orange hair]] and wears a [[yellow shirt]] and a pair of [[jeans]].

title: scott_pilgrim_(series)
body:
[b]Scott Pilgrim[/b] is a series of graphic stories by Bryan Lee O'Malley. 

The series is about [[Scott Pilgrim]], a slacker and part-time young musician (and occasional "hip street fighter") who lives in Toronto and plays bass guitar in the band [i]Sex [[Bob-Omb]][/i]. 

The comic has several classic video game references in its plot. The author has cited that the game [[Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari]] (known outside Japan as [i]River City Ransom[/i]) had a huge influence on it.

A film adaptation of the series titled [[Scott Pilgrim vs the World (movie)|]] and starring actor Michael Cera in the title role was released in August 2010.  A video game of the same name developed by Ubisoft for PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade was released the same month. An anime adaptation by [[Science SARU]] would release over a decade later in 2023 on [[Netflix]]. The animation, titled [[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off]], is notable for featuring the original movie cast reprising their roles.

title: imminent_spanking
body:
When a character is about to be [[spanked]], but the [[spanking]] hasn't happened yet. Typically seen when the character is in position to be spanked and the person spanking them is prepared as well with a raised hand or implement in hand. There may also be [[motion lines]] present to indicate the spanking is starting.

The [[ass]] should not have [[slap mark]]s or be red, this indicates that the spanking has yet to occur. If the [[ass]] is already red, then the [[spanked]] tag is more appropriate. 

For individual characters in the same illustration, spanked and imminent spanking are mutually exclusive unless its a [[comic]] or [[multiple views]].

title: medusa_(kid_icarus)
body:
A major character in the [[Kid Icarus]] series. She is the Goddess of Darkness, and formerly ruled Angel Land with [[Palutena]]. 

After she attacked humanity, she was cursed by Palutena to have a monstrous appearance, with [[snake hair]] and [[colored skin]]. She swore to get revenge on Palutena ever since.

In the original Kid Icarus, Medusa has [[green skin]], [[curly hair]], and a [[cyclops|single eye]]. She wears a [[pink dress]] and has [[claws|clawed hands]] and [[clawed feet|feet]].

As of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], she has a semi-humanoid appearance, with a [[facial tattoo]] and [[white skin]], and the skin on her arms fades into [[black scales]] and ends with monstrous [[claws]]. She wears a long [[purple dress]] that exposes a small bit of [[cleavage]] and has a [[sideboob]], and only has [[single_sleeve|one sleeve]]. Her dress fades into a deep red. She is adorned with various [[jewelry]], including a [[single earring]], and a snakelike [[gold armlet]]. 

After she is weakened by [[Pit_(kid_icarus)|Pit]] in Uprising, she exposes her true form, which has a similar single [[red eyes|red eye]] and [[fangs]] as her original design.

The Collin is a monster from the [[Kid Icarus]] Series. 

In the original Kid Icarus, the Collin resembles a [[Centurion]] with bulky [[gold armor]] and [[white wings]] on its back.

In [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], it retains its former appearance with some minor differences—it no longer has wings, and it possesses additional [[armor]], a red [[cape]], and two cannons from which it launches [[phil_(kid_icarus)|Phils]].

title: lee-enfield
body:
The Lee-Enfield is a series of [[bolt action]] [[rifle]]s that came in several models, chambered for .303 British [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. The [[weapon]] was named after its designer, James Paris [b]Lee[/b]—and the rifling design location—the Royal Small Arms Factory in [b]Enfield[/b]. It was the standard rifle of [[united kingdom|British]] and Commonwealth [[military|forces]] during [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]. 

The feed system is detachable 10-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]], usually fed from 5-round [[clip (weapon)|clips]].

* !post #6225815: Full-length Lee-Enfield (top) and the No. 5 Mk I "Jungle Carbine" variant with shortened stock (center).

title: m45_meusoc
body:
The MEU(SOC) [[handgun|pistol]], ("[b]M[/b]arine [b]e[/b]xpeditionary [b]u[/b]nit ([b]s[/b]pecial [b]o[/b]perations [b]c[/b]apable)") officially designated the M45 MEUSOC is an [[M1911]] variant. It became the sidearm for the Force Recon Element of the [[United States Marine Corps|USMC's]] Marine Expeditionary Units since 1985. The [[gun|handgun]] features some modernized features like longer pointy back spur, skeletonized external hammer, dovetail rear sights, a wraparound Pachmayr grip and a lighter trigger with hole(s). 

This also applies to its most recent variant, the M45A1 CQBP which was introduced in 2012. Visually identifiable by its railed dust cover, diagonal front slide serrations and desert tan coloring.

* !post #6334159: Comparison of the M45 MEUSOC (bottom) and the M1911 (top).

h4. See also

title: vivian_(paper_mario)
body:
A Shadow Siren from [[Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door]]. First confirmed transgender character in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] - the English localization of the original game changed this, but it was restored in the remake. 

She is a ghost with [[purple skin]] and [[ghost tail|a tail instead of legs]], long curly [[pink hair]], and a striped [[witch hat]].

Vivian is very shy and self-conscious. Her sisters, particularly [[Beldam]], constantly belittle her by calling her male terms despite her protests, though she is too shy to stand up for herself. She defects from her sisters to join [[Mario]]'s party and [spoilers]ultimately help him defeat her supposed master, the [[Shadow Queen]][/spoilers], learning to respect herself more along the way.

h4. External links

* "Mario Wiki: Vivian":https://www.mariowiki.com/Vivian

title: battleship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].
Large, durable but slow vessels designed for heavy duty engagement.

Battleships (BSs, rarely BBs from US Navy terminology) are the biggest, heaviest sub-capital [[combat ship (EVE Online)|]]s in EVE Online. They are correspondingly expensive, with even the cheapest battleship hulls selling for hundreds of millions of ISK. Tech 1 battleships are standard tools in higher-level PvE combat, are used in some large [[fleet]] doctrines in PvP combat, and are sometimes also used for solo or small gang PvP.
There are two classes of [[Tech 2 ship (EVE Online)|Tech 2]] battleships: [[Marauder (EVE Online)|]]s, which are specialized for mission-running, and Black Ops battleships, which can either transport fleets of stealthy ships across long distances using covert cynosural fields or open the door for friendly [[capital ship (EVE Online)|]]s to join a fight.
All battleships also come equipped with a [[Frigate (EVE Online)|]] Escape Bay, enabling battleship pilots to stay in a fight after their battleship explodes.
All battleships (except Praxis) have a role bonus known as the "battleship role bonus": 100% bonus to Shield Extender hitpoints, 50% bonus to Armor Plate hitpoints, 5% Additional bonus to Reinforced Bulkhead hitpoints.
Battleships use large weapons that are poor against small targets like frigates. All battleships (except Marshal) have a drone bay, allowing them to use [[combat drone (EVE Online)|drones]] to engage and kill enemies that they cannot hit with ship weapons.

h4. External links
* "EVE Universe: Battleships":https://universe.eveonline.com/lore/battleships
* "EVE University Wiki: Battleships":https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Battleships

title: aragami_oga_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Holostars]]' [[Aragami Oga]].

It consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[open shirt]] with [[sleeves rolled up]] and green [[high collar]], [[black pants]], left [[chest guard]] that has green [[tiger print]], a jeweled [[collar]] attached to patterned [[necktie]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]] with bright green sole and collar. On his hips he wears a [[holster]] that holds three brown [[pouch|pouches]] (in which he keeps a [[Game Boy Advance]], [[neo geo pocket color|Neo Geo Pocket]], and plenty of retro games, according to him), and he has a [[thigh pouch]]. He also wears [[partially fingerless gloves]], a round silver [[single earring]], and a black [[eyepatch]] - which can be removed at will.

h4. Appearance
* !post #3885976: Profile

title: jamaican_daningan
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] anime series from 1985.

[b]Jamaican Daninghan[/b] is the quintessential [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] officer, arrogant and heavily abusive towards his own men, and openly looked down upon every last one of them. A heavy smoking, thin and tall [[brown hair]]ed man with [[short hair]] and a massive moustache, Jamaican was one of [[Bask Om]]'s top henchmen, and often took point as the Titans primary field commander. He was heavily disliked by [[Yazan Gable]].

[spoiler]During a battle near an old [[Gwazine]] ship [[wreckage]] [[Yazan Gable]] lured [[AEUG]] pilot [[Emma Sheen]] into firing her [[Super Gundam]]'s long [[beam rifle]] at the bridge of Jamaican's battleship, killing Jamaican for him.[/spoiler]
other_names: ジャマイカン・ダニンガン

title: harapeko_yousai_wa_isekai_de_dai_senkan_ga_tsukuritai:_world_of_sandbox
body:
[i]Harapeko Yousai wa Isekai de Dai Senkan ga Tsukuritai: World of Sandbox[/i] (lit. [i]The Hungry Fortress Wants to Build a Battleship in Another World: World of Sandbox[/i]) is a sci-fi fantasy isekai light novel series by Tentenko and illustrated by [[Haga Yui]].

The series follows Eve, a male Japanese gamer hooked on a MMO space civilization builder, who awakes find that they're now inside their command fortress from the game and that they've become their female avatar.  Finding herself accompanied by her AI assistant from the game, Ringo, they learn they've been stranded in the middle of the ocean with limited resources and so begin rebuilding so they can secure resources to one day again reach for the stars.  Unfortunately things aren't going to be easy when they learn that the creatures and beings of this this world can possess powers that completely defy scientific theory. Thus begins the battle between sci-fi and fantasy.

h4. Characters

* [[Eve_(harapeko_yousai)|]]
* [[Ringo_(harapeko_yousai)|]]

* [[Olive_(harapeko_yousai)|]]
* [[Utsugi_(harapeko_yousai)|]]

title: today_is_friday_in_california_(meme)
body: A meme based around "a particular scene":[https://youtu.be/m1CW3MrwTeY] from [i][[Ninja Sentai Kakuranger]][/i] episode 46, titled "The New Year's Manga Hell". The scene takes place where the titular Kakurangers are trapped in an illusion made by Mujina, the youkai of the episode. One of the scenes involve Saizou/Ninja Blue in a hospital room, and the titular phrase is spoken by a patient inexplicably dressed as an American-style [[policeman]], much to Saizou's confusion, before said patient shoots at Saizou.

title: kuih
body: Kuih are bite-sized snack or dessert foods commonly found in Southeast Asia and China. They are colorful and are supposed to be peeled apart and then eaten.
